changelog: Initial generation for Mellowise LSAT prep platform

question_text: The new employee wellness program will reduce healthcare costs by 20%. Other companies with similar programs saw cost reductions. Our company will achieve similar savings. Which one of the following, if true, most strengthens this argument?

choices.text: Our employees have similar health profiles to those at companies in the studies.
The wellness program includes preventive care incentives.
Healthcare costs have been rising steadily for three years.
Employees have expressed interest in wellness programs.
The program will be implemented over six months.

explanations.general: For strengthen questions, look for evidence that makes the conclusion more likely to be true.

per_choice.explanation: Correct. This strengthens the analogy by establishing relevant similarity.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.

explanations.strategy_tips: Identify what gap or assumption the argument relies on, then find evidence that supports that assumption.

changelog: Initial generation for Mellowise LSAT prep platform

question_text: Installing speed cameras reduces traffic accidents by 30%. Studies from five cities show consistent results. Installing speed cameras on Highway 101 will reduce accidents there. Which one of the following, if true, most strengthens this argument?

choices.text: Highway 101 has traffic patterns similar to the studied roads.
Speed cameras are solar-powered and environmentally friendly.
The cameras will be monitored by trained traffic officers.
Local residents support the camera installation.
The highway has had 50 accidents in the past year.

explanations.general: For strengthen questions, look for evidence that makes the conclusion more likely to be true.

per_choice.explanation: Correct. This strengthens the analogy by establishing relevant similarity.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.
This doesn't strengthen the core argument about achieving similar results.

explanations.strategy_tips: Identify what gap or assumption the argument relies on, then find evidence that supports that assumption.

question_text: Installing speed cameras reduces traffic accidents by 30%. Studies from five cities show consistent results. Installing speed cameras on Highway 101 will reduce accidents there. Which one of the following, if true, most strengthens this argument?

choices.text: Highway 101 has traffic patterns similar to the studied roads.
Speed cameras are solar-powered and environmentally friendly.
The cameras will be monitored by trained traffic officers.
Local residents support the camera installation.
The highway has had 50 accidents in the past year.

explanations.general: For strengthen questions, look for evidence that makes the conclusion more likely to be true.

per_choice.explanation: Correct. This strengthens the analogy by establishing relevant similarity.
